Coconut oil is not good for your heart.  It was initially produced as a moisturizer to use externally on skin and hair, but then corporations saw $$$ signs started using it as an ingredient in our food and selling it as cooking oil. It was early 90s... I was a stupid teenager in his holidays. Not knowing, what my life would be. A head full of bullshit. It was 3 A.M. one hot summer night, i was watching TV. On one Channel this video started... this melody started, with these pictures, these lines, these words i never heard before. I still don't know, what it did to me. I started crying like a child, it gave me kind of a feeling that my youth will be over soon and a new chapter of life will start. I still remember so many years later, like it was yesterday. Now, today, when I go back to this moment nearly 30 years ago, all the words in this video make more sense then ever. Thank you for being with me all those years on my way from a child to a father...

Just think of the economies behind this. All these machines, some of which had to be specifically engineered for this particular factory. Every employee's salary. How many millions of chocolate mints do they have to sell to cover the costs of labour and ammortizing the equipment? And this doesn't even cover the parts of the company that aren't directly involved with production, like HR, accounting, marketing etc... all payed for by selling mints. Sometimes I think we don't appreciate the scales involved in manufacturing, even for such small factories as this one.

THE CONSTRUCTION OF LIFE

The culture of the modern age has come to be called the ‘culture of technology.’ But any culture based on technology will always have the characteristics of impermanence. It can never meet the eternal requirements of human nature. Technology can serve man, but it cannot be expected to provide man with the spiritual mainspring of his life that religion can. The right way is to make technology life’s servant, while adopting religion as the basis of one’s life. As Islam is the only religion which has been properly preserved and established, Islam provides a stable base for the construction of human life.

Maulana Wahiduddin Khan
26 Sep 2020
Full article at: https://www.cpsglobal.org/content/construction-life-1
